ygData.subject: voice recognition
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi everyone, Its not a NEAT specific question, but its in the right field :) I have written a voice recognition program using my own NN and genetic algo, since

Hi everyone,
Its not a NEAT specific question, but its in the right field :=
) 
I have written a voice recognition program using my own NN and 
genetic =
algo, since it worked so poorly (very slow to learn new 
words, took about =
3 hours for 4 words). I wanted to convert the 
program to use NEAT and to c=
hange a few concepts regarding the 
_inputs and outputs_. 
Please let me kn=
ow what do you think about this technique and if you 
know a better way:
1.=
 Perform normalizations on the sound and removing the non-relevant 
parts 
=
2. Perform FFT and focus on the vocal frequency only, separating the 
data =
to 16 "channels" (300Hz to 2.8KHz) 
3. Calculate the Polynom coefficient fo=
r each channel, coefficient 
level is 6.

=3D> 97 NN inputs, 6 x 16 (+bias)=
.
I wanted the output to be 6 "bit", having the ability to record 64 
diffe=
rent words per NN.

I want the learning to be relatively fast.. is this the=
 correct way? 
Any better idea?
Maybe I can try to learn the syllables and =
break the words to that.. 
but that's seams to be much more complicated.

T=
hanks,
Ariel.
